lead_paragraph: Mr. Sanders won the primary by appealing to white working-class voters, while Hillary Clinton had emphasized the auto industry bailout and the contaminated water in Flint.

byline.contributor: Amy Chozick, Steve Eder and Giovanni Russonello contributed reporting.
byline.original: By YAMICHE ALCINDOR and PATRICK HEALY

headline.print_headline: Trade and Jobs Swayed Voters Outside Detroit
headline.main: Trade and Jobs Key to Victory for Bernie Sanders

snippet: Mr. Sanders won the primary by appealing to white working-class voters, while Hillary Clinton had emphasized the auto industry bailout and the contaminated water in Flint.
abstract: Sen Bernie Sanders's appeal to working-class voters far outside of Detroit and his criticism of Hillary Clinton's support for America's trade policies drove his victory in Michigan primary; Sanders and many voters blame trade deals for loss of state's manufacturing jobs; outcome points to Clinton's weakness among working-class white male voters and independents.
